_header: O ye men that by me wend
Subjects: sermons, verse in; scripture texts, Engl. trans. of; Christ, appeal of, to man
_description:
‘O vos omnes qui transitis’, etc. (vv. 4), translating Lam. 1.12 — a tag in the Fasciculus morum; Wenzel (1978)
XWenzel, Siegfried. Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle English Poems. Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978, prints ‘A ȝe men…’

Bod410.Transcription:
A ȝe men þat by me wende a byde a whyle & loke on
                    meloke wher ȝe can knowe or fynde such sorweos I suffre vp on
                    þe tre

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
A ȝe men þat be me wendea byde a whyle & loke one
                    meloke where ȝe con knaw or fyndesoche sorow as I suffyr vp one
                    þis tre

BodRawC670.Transcription:
A ȝe men þat by me wendennAbydes a while & loke on
                    meȝef ȝe fyndenn in any endeSuche sorow as her ȝe se on
                    me
BodRawC670.Editions:
Woolf,  Rosemary. 
             The English Religious Lyric in the Middle Ages.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1968: 43.
Silverstein,  Theodore,
                        ed.  
             Medieval English Lyrics.
         York Medieval Texts. London: Edw. Arnold, 1971: 78.
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 165.

CamGon71.Transcription:
All þe men þat by me wenden Abyde a wyle & loke on
                    meIf ȝe fynden In any swylk sorw as ȝe sen on me

CamGon364.Transcription:
Ha ȝe men þat by me wendeabydyth aqwyle & lokyth on
                    meIf ȝe fynde in ony endeSwych peyne as ȝe fynde in
                    me

EDU82.Transcription:
Al ȝe men that be the waye wendA byde a whyle & loketh on
                    me¡yfe ¡e fynde in any othersyche sorowe as here ȝe see on
                    me

Lincoln44.Transcription:
Aȝen men by me wendeþA bydeþ a whyle an loke on
                    meIf ȝe fynde yn eny endesuche sorwe as here ȝe sen on
                    me

Spalding.Transcription:
Ye men þat by ye ware [wyd]a byde a whyle & loke on
                    meif ye fynde in any endeswylk sorow als ye may se in me

WorcF19.Transcription:
Al þe men þat by me wendynAbyd a qwyll & loke on
                    meIf þu fynde In ani endeSuche sorn als þe seie on
                    me
